definition: to make a new start/to regenerate
more/even more/further/still/still more
to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)
to begin/to start/then/only then

sentences.english: The deepened reform has injected a flow of fresh vitality into our national economic and social development.
sentences.chinese: 深化更始为国平易近经济和社会成长注入了新的活力。

sentences.english: The reform experiment inspects the way, raises student's scientific research and innovation ability.
sentences.chinese: 更始尝试查核体例，培育学生的科学研究与立异能力。

sentences.english: The ways Henry II reform the courts and the law.
sentences.chinese: 亨利二世对法院及法令进行更始的体例。

sentences.english: The combination of these exclusive caviars are perfect for a caviar tasting, and make an elegant gift.
sentences.chinese: 如果把这三种鱼子酱混在一起，味道更始别具一格。

sentences.english: With some pills, there can be an improvement in acne.
She is one of the strongest opponents of tax reform.
sentences.chinese: 她是税收更始最强烈的否决者之一。

sentences.english: Every family sets off fire-crackers at the turn of the new year.
sentences.chinese: 在这一年更始之时，家家户户放起了鞭炮。

sentences.english: That's on top of the extra hurdles to arrange routine care, like a colonoscopy.
sentences.chinese: 安排日常检查像一个大肠镜检查更始障碍重重。

definition: the Xin dynasty (8-23 AD) of Wang Mang 王莽, forming the interregnum between the former and later Han
to change an emperor's or ruler's reign title (old)
Cen Peng (died 35 AD), Chinese general
Shi Le, founder of Later Zhao of the Sixteen Kingdoms 後趙|后赵 (319-350)
posthumous name of the first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦 (256 or 247-195 BC), reigned 202-195 BC
to accept abdication
Fu Jian (338-385), emperor of Former Qin 前秦[Qian2 Qin2], reigning from 357-385
Cao Pi 曹丕, emperor of Wei 220-226
Later Yan of the Sixteen Kingdoms (384-409)
Later Han or Eastern Han dynasty (25-220)/Later Han of the Five Dynasties (947-950)
Emperor Xian of Han (181-234), the final Han emperor, set up by Dong Zhuo 董卓, reigned 189-220, forced to abdicate 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕
Former Yan of the Sixteen Kingdoms (337-370)
to usurp political power
Wang Mang (45 BC-23 AD), usurped power and reigned 9-23 between the former and later Han

Zhu Wen (852-912), military governor 節度使|节度使[jie2 du4 shi3] at the end of Tang, founder of Later Liang of the Five Dynasties (907-923), also known as Emperor Taizu of Later Liang 後梁太祖|后梁太祖[Hou4 Liang2 Tai4 zu3]
Cao Wei, the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms, established as a dynasty in 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕, son of Cao Cao, replaced by Jin dynasty in 265
